programme.desc: Fire Bomb!: A customer tries to rip off the store and quickly learns that Les is not one to cross. Meanwhile, a car is ablaze in the parking lot and someone could be inside. (S4, ep 3)

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les Walks Out: Les must attend a business meeting, so leaves Seth and Ashley to take care of American Jewellery. (S4, ep 4)

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les Loses it: Seth approaches his latest negotiation like a tiger, while a drunk customer becomes belligerent, and a customer's jewellery has been pierced through a body part. (S4, ep 5)

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Blood Lines: Ashley's negotiating skills cause a feud with Seth. Les is threatened with a trip to the hospital and is forced to make a decision that will change the business. (S4, ep 6)

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Turf Wars: Seth and Ashley square off to defend their turf. A fake ID puts Les in a dangerous situation and a business deal turns into a family brawl. (S4, ep 7)

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Auction Hunter Shuffle: Ton and Allen teach a cocky new auction hunter a lesson. Then, they get their hands on a hot rod made out of a World War II fighter plane. (S3, ep 3)

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: High Flying Ton: A fellow buyer tests Ton and Allen's patience at a container auction in Ventura, where they discover parts of a hot air balloon and a 19th-century rifle. (S3, ep 2)

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Night of the Digging Dead: Ton and Allen discover a 40s embalming pump and one of the first electric bone saws. They also find a shark cage, but is it safe to use? (S3, ep 1)

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Great American Cashtime: In San Diego, the guys get thrown a 50s pitching machine. They also rescue a Jaws of Life tool from the 80s. (S2, ep 26)

programme.title: Junk & Disorderly
programme.desc: Henry Cole heads solo to an automobilia and vintage toy auction, before his team regroups and heads to Newark autojumble. (S2, ep 9)

programme.title: Junk & Disorderly
programme.desc: Henry, Allen and Guy finally get their Buick Roadmaster, cruise to a Newbury car show, and do some wheeling and dealing. (S2, ep 10)

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: Area 52: Area 51 is considered the ultimate top secret facility, but there is another military site, known as Area 52, where strange phenomena have been witnessed for 10 years. (S3, ep 10)

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: Dark Presence: The team investigates growing numbers of flying orbs sightings, with witnesses also experiencing odd dreams, premonitions and deep fear. (S3, ep 11)

programme.title: Evidence Of The Unexplained
programme.desc: Thousands of UFO sightings and abductions are reported every year. This series examines these accounts and casts new light on historic cases. (S1, ep 10)

programme.title: Mysteries From Above
programme.desc: Out of Place: Discover strange aquatic mammals populating a river in Columbia, a ship marooned in sand along Namibia's Skeleton Coast and a Boeing 727 in a pine forest. (S2, ep 1)

programme.title: Mysteries From Above
programme.desc: Disaster From Above: Malta loses a natural treasure, an enormous fiery vortex is seen in California and a mysterious radioactive hotspot is found near Chernobyl. (S2, ep 2)

programme.title: Mysteries From Above
programme.desc: Ocean Mysteries: Discover an underwater find from a violent past, a mysterious concrete 'ghost island' and never-before-seen tracks along the seabed. (S2, ep 4)

programme.title: Mysteries From Above
programme.desc: A Whole Lot of Holes: Explore some of the most cavernous places on the planet, including a mysterious Siberian crater and Greenland's bizarre black holes. (S2, ep 8)

programme.title: Mysteries From Above
programme.desc: From Far Above: Uncover a perfect circle carved around an ancient peak, a scary phenomenon in the Pacific and strange shapes in a Middle Eastern desert. (S2, ep 9)

programme.title: Mysteries From Above
programme.desc: Ancient Civilizations: Decode the secrets of long-lost human settlements, uncovering a Norwegian mound, a prehistoric stone circle and a lost city in the cradle of civilisation. (S2, ep 10)

programme.title: Cities Of The Underworld
programme.desc: Gods Of War: Turkey has a history marked by conquerors vying for control of trade routes. Discover how a nation that was often at war turned to its underground for survival. (S3, ep 12)

programme.title: Curse Of Skinwalker Ranch
programme.desc: Behind The Gates: Hot, Hot, Hot Spots: Matty Blake and the team break down how the phenomena, and the locations where they happen on Skinwalker Ranch, may all be connected. (S5, ep 25)

programme.title: Curse Of Skinwalker Ranch
programme.desc: Behind The Gates: Phenomenal Connections: Dr Travis Taylor reviews evidence the team has documented, suggesting they may be close to revealing the secret of Skinwalker Ranch. (S5, ep 26)

programme.title: New: Forbidden History
programme.desc: The Secrets of the Devil's Bible: A full-page illustration of the Devil and hellish rumours gave the Devil's Bible its nickname, but who really wrote this book? (S7, ep 2)

programme.title: Egypt's Unexplained Files
programme.desc: Belief and Superstition: Science reveals new insights into belief and superstition in the land of the Pharaohs, from finding the long-lost 'Land of Punt' to Tutankhamun. (S1, ep 1)

programme.title: Egypt's Unexplained Files
programme.desc: Egyptian Genius: Journey back in time to understand the brainpower behind Ancient Egypt's revolutionary breakthroughs in every field, from medicine to engineering. (S1, ep 2)

programme.title: Close Encounters Down Under
programme.desc: Tasmania, New Zealand and the Bass Strait: Investigating the disappearance of pilot Frederick Valentich, whose last transmission gives an account of what he experienced. (S1, ep 2)

programme.title: Craig Charles: UFO Conspiracies
programme.desc: Wales: Craig Charles joins forces with world-renowned space journalist Sarah Cruddas to investigate some of the most perplexing UFO encounters of recent times. (S1, ep 1)

programme.title: Paranormal Survivor
programme.desc: No Place Like Home: Wendy and Glenn Laycock move into a new home, only to find that a previous owner hasn't moved out. (S4, ep 1)

programme.title: Haunted Hospitals
programme.desc: Nursing Home Nightmare, the Wailing Walls, Terror in Black and White: A nurse is stalked by a shadow, an EMT is terrorised, and a woman discovers that a nursing home is haunted. (S1, ep 4)

programme.title: Irish Pickers
programme.desc: Wexford: In Wexford town, the guys visit visit The Sky and the Ground pub where hoarder landlord Johnny Baron's wife Nuala thinks it's time for a clear-out. (S1, ep 9)

programme.title: Irish Pickers
programme.desc: Galway: Ian attends an auction which is selling fittings from the 1914 cruise ship Britannic, sister ship to the Titanic. (S1, ep 10)

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: First Lady of Pawn: Rick grapples over a decision when a WWE Hall of Fame ring hits the store. (S17, ep 14)

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Titanic Pawn: A 1906 Silver Half Dollar that belonged to a passenger on the Titanic sails into the shop. Will Rick snap it up or will it sink without trace? (S17, ep 16)

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Cold Hard Cash: Ton and Allen go north to Alaska and find two enormous seaplane pontoons and a pair of Smith & Wesson revolvers. (S3, ep 5)

programme.title: Storage Wars Texas
programme.desc: Hoopty Dreams: The buyers head to Fort Worth, where Victor seeks an ally in his bidding war with Ricky and Bubba. Others learn that two heads aren't always better than one. (S4, ep 12)

programme.title: Storage Wars Texas
programme.desc: Raiders Of The Lost Arkana: The buyers go to Texarkana in search of new territory. Slick Vic uncovers some action figures and Ricky and Bubba find an unforgettable antique. (S5, ep 1)

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Banned For Life: A man wants to buy some super-expensive earrings on the condition that the store also does his piercing. Will the Golds strike a deal? (S5, ep 4)

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Rematch: Ashley's nemesis Tressa returns to sell the Rolex that got her fired. Insults start to fly and not even Les can stop Ashley leaping over the counter. (S5, ep 5)

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les Hunts A Thief: Les goes on the rampage when he finds out a thief has been on his premises. Plus, a customer selling a guitar signed by Kid Rock reveals a valuable secret. (S5, ep 7)

programme.title: Alien Corridors
programme.desc: New Mexico: Every inexplicable flash or strange aircraft makes us believe we've spotted extraterrestrials - but what if they've been watching us all along? (S1, ep 7)

programme.title: Strange Evidence
programme.desc: A deadly shockwave hurtles towards a terrified driver. An alien signal rises from a deep ocean abyss, and a bizarre glowing orb swoops along a remote forest road. (S1, ep 9)

programme.title: MonsterQuest

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Lock, Stock And Pawn: Rick checks out various curious items including a 19th-century Hobbs & Co lock box and an original Woody Woodpecker painting. (S17, ep 18)

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Pawn No Evil: Chum checks out a Japanese animatronic monkey - is it worth a pretty penny or is the seller going to make a monkey out of him? (S17, ep 15)

programme.desc: Henry Cole, Allen Millyard and Guy Willison are back! This time, they revamp their stall after picking up a vanload of trinkets. (S3, ep 4)

programme.desc: This edition of the show is hosted by the magnificent Suzi Ruffell, who welcomes comedians Alfie Brown and Sikisa to the stage.

programme.title: Schitt's Creek
programme.desc: General Store: More comedic capers from the backwater town with a novel name. David comes up with a new business venture, and Alexis adjusts to her first day of school.

programme.title: Schitt's Creek
programme.desc: Motel Review: Charmingly quirky comedy. David meets a new friend while setting up his business, Johnny defends Alexis's schoolwork, and Moira deals with a difficult guest at the motel.

programme.title: Schitt's Creek
programme.desc: The Affair: Liaise once again with the multi-award-winning sitcom. Moira and Roland find themselves in a compromising situation, and Alexis drives a wedge between David and Patrick.

programme.title: Schitt's Creek
programme.desc: Sebastien Raine: Another edition of the all-embracing smash-hit comedy. David's ex comes to town to do a photoshoot for Moira, and Johnny and Roland think that Bob is cheating at poker.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Amol Rajan is host as actor and comedian Miles Jupp and Dame Andrea Jenkyns join team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop to delve into the news.

programme.desc: Shopping from Home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Shopping from Home.

programme.title: The Boat That Guy Built
programme.desc: A Nice Hot Shower: Motorsport ace Guy Martin turns his attention to the water in this renovation series. Guy decides to use a steam engine to power the shower on board his narrowboat.

programme.title: Special Ops: To Catch A Criminal
programme.desc: Operation Earth: An RSPCA Special Ops team investigate an international criminal puppy farming operation, and Lancashire officers prosecute an owner for animal cruelty.

programme.title: Special Ops: To Catch A Criminal
programme.desc: Operation Harlequin: The Serious Fraud Office go undercover to investigate a suspect holiday home company offering exclusive residences in the sun-drenched Caribbean.

programme.title: Bradford on Duty
programme.desc: Levelling Up: An unflinchingly honest account of the challenges faced by Bradford's public services as they work together to tackle social inequalities and restore pride in their city.

programme.title: Rick Stein's India
programme.desc: Madurai and Lucknow: Rick Stein discovers a five-star hotel in Madurai employing local housewives for genuine home-cooked dishes and enjoys Chettinad Chicken, a dish inspired by global spices.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Poplar: Storage bin scuffles with that cor blimey guv'nor of auctions, 'septic tank' Sean Kelly. In London, Heavy D goes through his blue period after driving the bidders mad.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Leamington Spa: The crowd-pulling reality series crosses the Atlantic and puts on a British accent. Heavy D gets more than he bargained for, while Nat and John feel cheated.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Alton: The cut-throat auction show that's 'lots' of fun. Things escalate between Nat and Boudicca. There are explosive consequences when Scotty fails to read a warning sign!

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Hull: More auction antics as salvage supremos fight over lumber on the Humber. Nat can't cope with both voodoo magic and Heavy D. Luckily, Sean has an emergency vehicle to hand!

programme.title: Cape Carnage: Killer Catch
programme.desc: A Stormy Start: Captain Bruce Davey, his family and his ship - the M.V. Wildcard - set off on a four-month season of fishing for mackerel off of the coast of northern Australia.

programme.title: Top Gear

programme.title: Below Deck Down Under
programme.desc: All's Fair in Love and Downpour: Heavy wind and rain threaten a tricky beach picnic. And romantic entanglements get knotty when a surprising new hookup happens

programme.title: Below Deck Down Under
programme.desc: Everyone Everywhere All at Once: A love pentagon forms as crew romances heat up, and a dinner service for the guests goes awry when preferences are overlooked.

programme.title: Hollyoaks Omnibus
programme.desc: Jez and John Paul are about to tie the knot, but Jez has some loose ends to tie up... Bobby risks everything, and Tony makes a life-changing detour. With revenge in the air, is anyone safe?

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Jez and John Paul are about to tie the knot, but Jez has loose ends to tie up - no matter the cost. Elsewhere, a resident is stood up. And can Bobby escape the village before it's too late?

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: As the wedding day drama continues, emotions run high and danger is closing in fast. One resident spirals and Tony makes a life-changing detour. With Jez's revenge imminent, is anyone safe?

programme.title: Rude(ish) Tube Shorts
programme.desc: A short, cheeky clip from Rude Tube's naughty little sister Rude(ish) Tube, featuring sheep.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Nino's: Gordon visits Long Beach in California to save Nino's, a failing Italian restaurant that opened in 1958 and is now under the misguided leadership of eldest son, Nino.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Mill Street Bistro Part 1: Gordon visits Ohio. The owner of the Mill Street Bistro claims to have the best menu between New York and LA. But the diners don't agree.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer and Lisa Exchange Cross Words: Lisa discovers that she has a knack for crosswords and enters a tournament. But Homer thinks he can make money by betting on her to lose.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Mypods and Broomsticks: Homer suspects that Bart's new friend's Muslim family are terrorists. Meanwhile, Lisa becomes addicted to downloading songs on her new Mypod.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: An Ankle Monitor and a Big Plastic Crap House: Sheldon studies to be Meemaw's lawyer when she's put on house arrest, and the Coopers have a plumbing emergency.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: A Fancy Article and a Scholarship for a Baby: Sheldon's published paper leads to a frenzy of grad school recruiting, and Georgie tries to speak more 'properly'.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Frank's Wedding: Frank Dunphy's Roaring Twenties-themed wedding day is finally here, and to get into the spirit, Phil gets the Dunphy clan to show up in costume.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: All Things Being Equal: Gloria, Claire, Haley, Alex, Lily, Luke and Manny are committed to supporting gender equality and the women's movement, but in very different ways.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Neonatal Nomenclature: Bernadette's friends try various tactics to help her go into labour.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Athenaeum Allocation: Leonard jumps through hoops to secure the perfect wedding venue for Sheldon and Amy. Howard and Bernadette face a big decision.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Gates Excitation: The guys do everything in their power to meet Bill Gates when his firm has dealings with the pharmaceutical company Penny works for.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Tenant Disassociation: Leonard competes with Sheldon to become president of the tenants' association. Howard and Raj find a drone in the back garden.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Pilot: US comedy about a group of New York City police detectives. A talented but carefree detective is taken aback when a strict new captain takes over at his precinct.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: The Tagger: When Peralta turns up late for morning roll call, Captain Holt responds by assigning him to a minor graffiti case and then closely monitoring his every move.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Eeny Teeny Maya Moe: Homer takes Maggie to Moe's and accidentally leaves her in the playground outside the bar. Meanwhile, Moe's delighted to get to know a young woman online.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The Good, the Sad and the Drugly: A volunteer inspires Bart to become a better person. Lisa writes an essay about what Springfield will be like in 50 years' time.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Confirmation Polarization: Sheldon and Amy are thrilled when their super-asymmetry theory is proved correct. Bernadette enjoys some big success at work.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Meteorite Manifestation: Sheldon is thrilled to help Howard and Bernadette with some bureaucratic paperwork, until he realises that they're breaking the law.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Donation Oscillation: Penny attempts to sabotage Leonard's efforts to help her ex-boyfriend Zack and his wife Marissa have a family of their own.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The D & D Vortex: When the gang find out that Wil Wheaton is hosting a celebrity game of Dungeons & Dragons at his home, deception and betrayal take hold.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The Serfsons: In a fantasy world, the peasant Simpsons struggle with Marge's mother's illness. And Lisa's magic powers lead to her capture.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Springfield Splendor: Lisa and Marge team up on a graphic novel that becomes a musical. But Marge takes all the credit...

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: It's The Dog's grand reopening - but celebration is the last thing on some people's minds... Ste comes across a spiralling John Paul, and a public display of affection shocks residents.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Diary Queen: Bart finds his old teacher's diary and learns a surprising secret. Then Lisa discovers an even bigger surprise.

programme.title: New: Below Deck
programme.desc: Brand new series - Royal Rumble: Ben's wandering eyes upset Sunny. There's major drama when new guests are royally demanding. And Fraser reaches breaking point with Barbie.

programme.title: Gogglebox

programme.title: News
programme.desc: The leading news stories of the moment.

programme.title: The Equalizer
programme.desc: (2014) Thriller. Denzel Washington stars as an ex-soldier who comes out of retirement to help a teenage sex worker who's been assaulted by her pimp.

programme.title: My Friend Dahmer
programme.desc: (2017) Ross Lynch portrays serial killer Jeffrey Dahmer at high school in this biographical drama based on John 'Derf' Backderf's graphic novel.

programme.title: Your Name.
programme.desc: (2016) Exquisitely romantic anime. A city boy falls for a country girl when they swap bodies. But after the connection is broken, he sets out to find his love. In Japanese/subs.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: First Men in the Moon
programme.desc: (1964) Sci-fi starring Lionel Jeffries. An eccentric Victorian inventor builds the first spacecraft to land on the moon, which is inhabited by ant-like beings - animated by Ray Harryhausen.

programme.title: Muppets from Space
programme.desc: (1999) The Muppets are back in another feature-length adventure as Gonzo, convinced that he is of alien origin, struggles to communicate with his family in outer space.

programme.title: Jingle All the Way
programme.desc: (1996) Brian Levant's festive all-action comedy. Arnold Schwarzenegger is on a mission to get his son (Jake Lloyd) the must-have Christmas toy, Turbo Man. But it's sold out everywhere...

programme.title: Local Hero
programme.desc: (1983) Comedy starring Peter Riegert, Burt Lancaster and Peter Capaldi. A US oil company executive tries to persuade a small Scottish seaside community to sell up their entire village.

programme.title: Fatherhood
programme.desc: (2021) Heartfelt fact-based comedy-drama. Kevin Hart stars as a widower who is suddenly sprung into single fatherhood after his wife dies a day after giving birth.

programme.title: Battleship
programme.desc: (2012) Sci-fi action-adventure starring Taylor Kitsch, Liam Neeson and Rihanna. When aliens land spacecraft in the Pacific Ocean, only the US and Japanese navies can save Earth. Violence.

programme.title: Die Hard
programme.desc: (1988) Action-thriller with Bruce Willis and Alan Rickman. Can a New York cop free the hostages being held in a skyscraper by an arch villain? Yippee ki-yay... whoops, can't say that here.

programme.title: Action Point
programme.desc: (2018) Zany comedy with Johnny Knoxville about giving a failing theme park an excitement enema, featuring real stunts not to be copied unless you are honed by years of appearing on Jackass.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Tad the Lost Explorer and the...
programme.desc: ...Curse of the Mummy: (2022) Animated family adventure. After Tad accidentally unleashes a curse - doh! - he and his friends must find the Emerald Tablet to save the world.

programme.title: Anastasia
programme.desc: (1997) Animated drama. When the Russian royal family is murdered, the sole surviving child is separated from her grandmother. Years later, conmen try to exploit the reward for her return.

programme.title: Mousehunt
programme.desc: (1997) Raucous comedy. Two brothers go to immense lengths to try to rid their mansion of a mouse. The mouse goes to immense lengths to rid its mansion of the two brothers. Who will win?

programme.title: Cutthroat Island
programme.desc: (1995) Swashbuckling adventure. Geena Davis and Matthew Modine star as pirates racing to find the missing parts of their treasure map and beat an evil rival (Frank Langella) to the booty.

programme.title: Charlie's Angels
programme.desc: (2019) Action comedy with Kristen Stewart, Naomi Scott and Ella Balinska. When an engineer blows the whistle on a deadly device, the Angels put their lives on the line to save the planet.

programme.title: Transporter 2
programme.desc: (2005) Violent action-thriller starring Jason Statham as the tough courier Frank Martin, who's hired to guard a government drugs czar's son. But his mission soon lurches towards disaster.

programme.title: Wild Card
programme.desc: (2015) Sin City thriller with Jason Statham. A compulsive gambler who does favours for money just wants out of the Vegas life. Just one big win at the tables should do it...

programme.title: Straightheads
programme.desc: (2007) Thriller starring Gillian Anderson and Danny Dyer. On their way to a party in the country, a couple are brutally attacked by thugs. Months later, they set out for gory vengeance.

programme.title: Crawlspace
programme.desc: (2022) Tense thriller with Henry Thomas. A plumber gets trapped in the crawlspace of a house with a stash of cash that two bad guys want back. And they'll shoot blindly at walls to get it.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: LumoTV: The Beautiful Game
programme.desc: Documentary. Footballer Marios Costi explores the thrills and spills of the 2019 Deaf Champions League tournament. (Ep2/2)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Ferdinand
programme.desc: (2017) Charming animated bovine road movie from the makers of Ice Age. A huge but gentle bull (voiced by John Cena) tries to get home after being sent away to a bull fighting ranch.

programme.title: The Karate Kid Part III
programme.desc: (1989) Ralph Macchio and Pat Morita return as the pupil with problems and the karate teacher who doesn't like fighting. This time, Daniel is tricked into defending his All Valley title.

programme.title: The Smallest Show On Earth
programme.desc: (1957) Comedy with Bill Travers and Virginia McKenna as a couple who inherit a dilapidated fleapit cinema, along with its equally dilapidated staff: Peter Sellers, Margaret Rutherford.

programme.title: San Demetrio, London
programme.desc: (1943) Fact-based drama about a group of Merchant Navy sailors who brave fire and the ocean to save the San Demetrio oil tanker after it's almost destroyed by a German cruiser.

programme.title: Belle
programme.desc: (2014) Amma Asante's powerful fact-based drama about Britain's first Black aristocrat. Gugu Mbatha-Raw portrays the extraordinary Dido Belle. Featuring Matthew Goode and Tom Wilkinson.

programme.title: Ticket to Paradise

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: Lively debate and discussion with our panel of paper reviewers about the stories making tomorrow morning's newspapers.

programme.title: Breaking the Silence: Kate's Story
programme.desc: Former MP Kate Kniveton gives a frank and full insight into her experience of being abused and shamed into silence over 10 years by her ex-husband Andrew Griffiths, who was then a Conservative government minister. Kate also meets other high-achieving professional women who were secretly suffering appalling abuse behind closed doors and who, like her, felt there was no way they could escape the relationship. In this powerful documentary for the Exposure strand, Kate also sheds new light on the secretive world of the family court and shows how perpetrators can play the system to continue their abuse and how judges can get it badly wrong when it comes to protecting survivors and their children

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Tour de France Highlights
programme.desc: Action from stage 19, which consisted of a 95km route from Albertville to La Plagne. Gary Imlach presents, with analysis from Pete Kennaugh, commentary by Ned Boulting and David Millar, and interviews from reporters Daniel Friebe and Matt Rendell

programme.title: Ainsley's Food We Love
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott takes inspiration from days beside the seaside, starting with a Caribbean squash and chickpea roti with hot sauce yoghurt, joined by former Bake Off winner Candice Brown, who puts her twist on toffee apple doughnuts. Olly Smith hunts out the perfect wines for sipping by the seashore and, as no trip to the beach would be complete without some ice cream, Ainsley has just the ticket with his homemade honeycomb sundae with butterscotch sauce

programme.title: Mrs Doubtfire
programme.desc: Comedy drama starring Robin Williams, Sally Field and Pierce Brosnan. When voiceover artist Daniel Hillard walks out of his day job, his wife Miranda decides it's time to walk out on him, and is granted custody of their children. Daniel is desperate to be with his kids, so when Miranda advertises for a nanny-cum-housekeeper he applies for the job in disguise.

programme.title: Jimmy & Shivi's Farmhouse Breakfast
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty and Shivi Ramoutar are joined by actress Su Pollard for a sweet potato and courgette tortilla breakfast. Jimmy sets up a salad bar for some very hungry goats at the wildlife park, a local expert shows everyone how to make a fresh flower arrangement, and Shivi tries her hand at knife-making

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is back in the kitchen and is serving up a couple of delicious dishes for Nigel Havers while also enjoying recipes from chefs Dipna Anand, Tony Tobin, and Jonathan Phang.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John Torode and Lisa Faulkner get creative with the humble and versatile potato featuring in four exciting and inspiring recipes, starting with fish pie, and beans and cheese fillings for jacket potatoes. They then move on to a veggie cottage pie with lentils, a potato-based cheese and pancetta quiche, and cheeseburgers with potato buns that are both tempting and delicious

programme.title: Tom Kerridge Cooks Spain
programme.desc: Tom is on the road in his bespoke vintage food truck in northern Spain to meet food producers who are as obsessed with growing ingredients as he is about cooking them. After local producer Levi shows him that everyone in Santona is connected to anchovies, from the fishermen and cannery workers to a group of local women who keep the town's traditions alive, Tom gets stuck in with local farmer Jose-Alonso in Leon as they try to protect white beans from the stony ground there

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: STV Racing: Live from Ascot
programme.desc: Francesca Cumani and Ed Chamberlin present coverage of a meeting headlined by the King George VI and Queen Elizabeth Stakes from Ascot, plus racing from York. With analysis from Jason Weaver and Adele Mulrennan, reports by Oli Bell, Matt Chapman and Mick FitzGerald, and commentary from Richard Hoiles

programme.title: Tipping Point: Lucky Stars
programme.desc: Ben Shephard asks the questions as Sara Pascoe, Lucy Pargeter and Joe Marler answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the better their chances of collecting the £20,000 prize for their selected charity

programme.title: Shark! Celebrity Infested Waters
programme.desc: The famous faces discover their final mission will be to swim with 18-foot tiger sharks. Ade Adepitan struggles to master his special diving equipment during a training exercise and makes a mad dash for a boat with sharks all around him. Meanwhile, Lucy Punch and Ross Noble find themselves in 'predator alley', Helen George suffers a panic attack and falls behind the team during scuba training, and the stars enjoy a spectacular coral reef dive before learning about their next encounter

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Cheryl Baker, Laura Tobin, Jason Bell and Mark Steel pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: The 1% Club
programme.desc: Quiz game show hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin every show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to £100,000?

programme.title: Skyfall
programme.desc: Spy adventure starring Daniel Craig as agent James Bond. When an operation to retrieve a computer hard drive containing the names of agents goes wrong, the authority of MI6 boss M comes under scrutiny. Her only ally seems to be Bond, who is assigned to track down the mastermind behind the theft. It's a mission that will reveal long-hidden secrets from M's and Bond's pasts.

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Suspicion
programme.desc: The suspects prepare to flee, but each must decide which way to run. Vanessa shares a secret with Scott. Katherine does client damage control.

programme.title: Shark! Celebrity Infested Waters
programme.desc: The famous faces discover their final mission will be to swim with 18-foot tiger sharks. programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Tour de France Highlights
programme.desc: Action from stage 20, which consisted of a 184.2km route from Nantua to Pontarlier. Gary Imlach presents, with commentary from Ned Boulting and David Millar, with interviews by reporters Daniel Friebe and Matt Rendell.

programme.title: James Martin's French Adventure
programme.desc: The chef arrives in the riverside town of L'Isle-sur-la-Sorgue in south-eastern France, where his culinary hero Keith Floyd once owned a restaurant. Buying produce from its floating market, and a Floyd-style hat, James sets up his mobile kitchen on a bridge overlooking the river, and cooks peaches pain perdu in the sunshine. Heading back in the direction of the town, James samples some truffle-laden dishes at renowned restaurant La Beaugraviere

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is back in the kitchen and is serving up a couple of delicious dishes for Nigel Havers while also enjoying recipes from chefs Dipna Anand, Tony Tobin, and Jonathan Phang.

programme.title: Katie Piper's Weekend Escape
programme.desc: Katie is joined by comedian Laura Smyth to try belly dancing, hairdresser Michael Douglas and make-up artist Genevieve Turley transform another charity founder, and Aldo Zilli serves up delicious mocktails

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Alan is joined by actor and comedian Brian Conley and actress Thelma Barlow, while DIY expert Wayne Perrey upcycles an old dresser into a potting station for the show's new greenhouse, and garden designer Chris Hull plants trees

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Ninja Warrior UK
programme.desc: Competitors from across the nation test their strength, speed and courage in the semi-final of the obstacle-course challenge, hosted by Ben Shephard, Rochelle Humes and Chris Kamara. Those who make it to the end of the adrenaline-fuelled mission face one final task - scaling the heights of a tower named Mount Midoriyama - as they battle it out for the title of Ninja Warrior UK. With brand new obstacles to face, the course is more extreme than ever, as the best competitors from four heats return to fight it out for a place in the final

programme.title: The Man with the Golden Gun
programme.desc: Spy adventure starring Roger Moore and Christopher Lee. James Bond goes in search of a solar-energy device stolen by professional killer Scaramanga - a hitman who carries out his million-dollar assignments with a golden gun.

programme.title: UEFA Women's Euro 2025 Final
programme.desc: England v Spain (Kick-off 5.00pm). All the action from the showpiece match, held at St Jakob-Park in Basel, Switzerland. England went into this tournament as the holders, having defeated Germany 2-1 after extra time on home soil three years ago thanks to substitute Chloe Kelly's winner, and they have had to work hard to reach this final, first finishing as runners-up to France in their group and then defeating Sweden on penalties in the quarter-finals, before prevailing 2-1 against Italy after extra time in the last four. Things are not expected to get any easier in this showpiece match, as Spain defeated England 1-0 in the 2023 FIFA World Cup final and comfortably topped their group before winning 2-0 against Switzerland in the last eight and also needing extra time in their semi-final to overcome Germany

programme.title: Karen Pirie
programme.desc: With the suspects in focus, the team works together to dive deeper into the case and Catriona's life, while Karen hits a brick wall when she comes face to face with Adam's father Fergus. When Sir Broderick then makes a shock decision, can she prove her theory before the case is shut for good?

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Taken 3
programme.desc: Action drama starring Liam Neeson and Forest Whitaker. Former government agent Bryan Mills is framed for murder and is forced to go on the run to clear his name.

programme.title: Motorsport UK
programme.desc: Richard John Neil presents action from Snetterton featuring racing from the Porsche Carrera Cup Great Britain and the Wera Tools F4 British Championship.

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Tour de France Highlights
programme.desc: Action from stage 21, which consisted of a 132.3km route from Mantes-la-Ville to Paris, with the climax being the traditional finish along the Champs-Élysées. Gary Impach presents, with analysis from Chris Boardman and Pete Kennaugh, commentary by Ned Boulting and David Millar, and interviews by reporters Daniel Friebe and Matt Rendell

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Early morning chat show presented by Lorraine Kelly, with celebrity interviews, entertainment news, cooking tips, fashion features and musical guests.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Celebrity interviews and studio discussion from a female perspective

programme.title: ITV Lunchtime News
programme.desc: The key headlines from the day so far

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: Celebrity Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts as contestants Roisin Conaty, Rickie Haywood-Williams and Sunetra Sarker 'see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win £50,000 for the charity of their choice

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: This time, competitive brothers Louis and Connor from Stockport, married couple Julie and Joe from Hull, and quiz fans Suzy and Dave from Chester try to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. Presented by Adil Ray

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Rosie from Chelmsford, Steve originally from Wakefield, Kallan from Cardiff and Seb from Wareham take on one of the country's finest quiz brains

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Cain and Moira take revenge on Kim, while Mack misses his opportunity to express his feelings and Robert is suspicious of John's heroism

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Abi's discovery of Kevin's despicable lie propels her into Carl's arms, Sam gives Lily a taste of her own medicine, and a meeting to determine Laila's future takes place

programme.title: Shark! Celebrity Infested Waters
programme.desc: Natural history meets adrenaline-fuelled entertainment as ocean-phobic celebrities come face-to-face with nature’s most terrifying underwater predators

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Yorkshire Ripper: The Secret Murders
programme.desc: Part two of two. The pressure continues to build on West Yorkshire Police as they step up the hunt for the killer, now being dubbed by the press, the Yorkshire Ripper. On top of the crimes that police decide to include in the Ripper investigation, murders and attempted murders with a clear link to the killer are discarded and left unsolved. When a series of mysterious letters and tapes are received by the senior detectives, the investigation is derailed even further, allowing the Ripper to go on killing. Later, a third innocent man is sent to prison for life

programme.title: Heathrow: Britain's Busiest Airport
programme.desc: Documentary going behind the scenes of the airport, finding out how its infrastructure helps staff process thousands of passengers arriving from 84 countries. The discovery of a new variant of Covid-19 causes chaos in Heathrow as airports around the world begin to close their borders to the UK. As flights are cancelled before the passengers' eyes, they scramble to get on any available plane in a desperate attempt to get home

programme.title: The Chase

programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Cain and Moira take revenge on Kim, while Mack misses his opportunity to express his feelings and Robert is suspicious of John's heroism

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Abi's discovery of Kevin's despicable lie propels her into Carl's arms, Sam gives Lily a taste of her own medicine, and a meeting to determine Laila's future takes place

programme.title: Shark! Celebrity Infested Waters
programme.desc: Natural history meets adrenaline-fuelled entertainment as ocean-phobic celebrities come face-to-face with nature’s most terrifying underwater predators

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Yorkshire Ripper: The Secret Murders
programme.desc: Part two of two. The pressure continues to build on West Yorkshire Police as they step up the hunt for the killer, now being dubbed by the press, the Yorkshire Ripper. On top of the crimes that police decide to include in the Ripper investigation, murders and attempted murders with a clear link to the killer are discarded and left unsolved. When a series of mysterious letters and tapes are received by the senior detectives, the investigation is derailed even further, allowing the Ripper to go on killing. Later, a third innocent man is sent to prison for life

programme.title: Heathrow: Britain's Busiest Airport
programme.desc: Documentary going behind the scenes of the airport, finding out how its infrastructure helps staff process thousands of passengers arriving from 84 countries. The discovery of a new variant of Covid-19 causes chaos in Heathrow as airports around the world begin to close their borders to the UK. As flights are cancelled before the passengers' eyes, they scramble to get on any available plane in a desperate attempt to get home

programme.title: Breaking the Silence: Kate's Story
programme.desc: Former MP Kate Kniveton gives a frank and full insight into her experience of being abused and shamed into silence over 10 years by her ex-husband Andrew Griffiths, who was then a Conservative government minister. Kate also meets other high-achieving professional women who were secretly suffering appalling abuse behind closed doors and who, like her, felt there was no way they could escape the relationship. In this powerful documentary for the Exposure strand, Kate also sheds new light on the secretive world of the family court and shows how perpetrators can play the system to continue their abuse and how judges can get it badly wrong when it comes to protecting survivors and their children

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Tour de France Highlights
programme.desc: Action from stage 19, which consisted of a 95km route from Albertville to La Plagne. Gary Imlach presents, with analysis from Pete Kennaugh, commentary by Ned Boulting and David Millar, and interviews from reporters Daniel Friebe and Matt Rendell

programme.title: Ainsley's Food We Love
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott takes inspiration from days beside the seaside, starting with a Caribbean squash and chickpea roti with hot sauce yoghurt, joined by former Bake Off winner Candice Brown, who puts her twist on toffee apple doughnuts. Olly Smith hunts out the perfect wines for sipping by the seashore and, as no trip to the beach would be complete without some ice cream, Ainsley has just the ticket with his homemade honeycomb sundae with butterscotch sauce

programme.title: Mrs Doubtfire
programme.desc: Comedy drama starring Robin Williams, Sally Field and Pierce Brosnan. When voiceover artist Daniel Hillard walks out of his day job, his wife Miranda decides it's time to walk out on him, and is granted custody of their children. Daniel is desperate to be with his kids, so when Miranda advertises for a nanny-cum-housekeeper he applies for the job in disguise.

programme.title: Jimmy & Shivi's Farmhouse Breakfast
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty and Shivi Ramoutar are joined by actress Su Pollard for a sweet potato and courgette tortilla breakfast. Jimmy sets up a salad bar for some very hungry goats at the wildlife park, a local expert shows everyone how to make a fresh flower arrangement, and Shivi tries her hand at knife-making

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is back in the kitchen and is serving up a couple of delicious dishes for Nigel Havers while also enjoying recipes from chefs Dipna Anand, Tony Tobin, and Jonathan Phang.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John Torode and Lisa Faulkner get creative with the humble and versatile potato featuring in four exciting and inspiring recipes, starting with fish pie, and beans and cheese fillings for jacket potatoes. They then move on to a veggie cottage pie with lentils, a potato-based cheese and pancetta quiche, and cheeseburgers with potato buns that are both tempting and delicious

programme.title: Tom Kerridge Cooks Spain
programme.desc: Tom is on the road in his bespoke vintage food truck in northern Spain to meet food producers who are as obsessed with growing ingredients as he is about cooking them. After local producer Levi shows him that everyone in Santona is connected to anchovies, from the fishermen and cannery workers to a group of local women who keep the town's traditions alive, Tom gets stuck in with local farmer Jose-Alonso in Leon as they try to protect white beans from the stony ground there

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: STV Racing: Live from Ascot
programme.desc: Francesca Cumani and Ed Chamberlin present coverage of a meeting headlined by the King George VI and Queen Elizabeth Stakes from Ascot, plus racing from York. With analysis from Jason Weaver and Adele Mulrennan, reports by Oli Bell, Matt Chapman and Mick FitzGerald, and commentary from Richard Hoiles

programme.title: Tipping Point: Lucky Stars
programme.desc: Ben Shephard asks the questions as Sara Pascoe, Lucy Pargeter and Joe Marler answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the better their chances of collecting the £20,000 prize for their selected charity

programme.title: Shark! Celebrity Infested Waters
programme.desc: The famous faces discover their final mission will be to swim with 18-foot tiger sharks. Ade Adepitan struggles to master his special diving equipment during a training exercise and makes a mad dash for a boat with sharks all around him. Meanwhile, Lucy Punch and Ross Noble find themselves in 'predator alley', Helen George suffers a panic attack and falls behind the team during scuba training, and the stars enjoy a spectacular coral reef dive before learning about their next encounter

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Cheryl Baker, Laura Tobin, Jason Bell and Mark Steel pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: The 1% Club
programme.desc: Quiz game show hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin every show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to £100,000?

programme.title: Skyfall
programme.desc: Spy adventure starring Daniel Craig as agent James Bond. When an operation to retrieve a computer hard drive containing the names of agents goes wrong, the authority of MI6 boss M comes under scrutiny. Her only ally seems to be Bond, who is assigned to track down the mastermind behind the theft. It's a mission that will reveal long-hidden secrets from M's and Bond's pasts.

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Suspicion
programme.desc: The suspects prepare to flee, but each must decide which way to run. Vanessa shares a secret with Scott. Katherine does client damage control.

programme.title: Shark! Celebrity Infested Waters

programme.title: Tour de France Highlights
programme.desc: Action from stage 20, which consisted of a 184.2km route from Nantua to Pontarlier. Gary Imlach presents, with commentary from Ned Boulting and David Millar, with interviews by reporters Daniel Friebe and Matt Rendell.

programme.title: James Martin's French Adventure
programme.desc: The chef arrives in the riverside town of L'Isle-sur-la-Sorgue in south-eastern France, where his culinary hero Keith Floyd once owned a restaurant. Buying produce from its floating market, and a Floyd-style hat, James sets up his mobile kitchen on a bridge overlooking the river, and cooks peaches pain perdu in the sunshine. Heading back in the direction of the town, James samples some truffle-laden dishes at renowned restaurant La Beaugraviere

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is back in the kitchen and is serving up a couple of delicious dishes for Nigel Havers while also enjoying recipes from chefs Dipna Anand, Tony Tobin, and Jonathan Phang.

programme.title: Katie Piper's Weekend Escape
programme.desc: Katie is joined by comedian Laura Smyth to try belly dancing, hairdresser Michael Douglas and make-up artist Genevieve Turley transform another charity founder, and Aldo Zilli serves up delicious mocktails

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Alan is joined by actor and comedian Brian Conley and actress Thelma Barlow, while DIY expert Wayne Perrey upcycles an old dresser into a potting station for the show's new greenhouse, and garden designer Chris Hull plants trees

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Ninja Warrior UK
programme.desc: Competitors from across the nation test their strength, speed and courage in the semi-final of the obstacle-course challenge, hosted by Ben Shephard, Rochelle Humes and Chris Kamara. Those who make it to the end of the adrenaline-fuelled mission face one final task - scaling the heights of a tower named Mount Midoriyama - as they battle it out for the title of Ninja Warrior UK. With brand new obstacles to face, the course is more extreme than ever, as the best competitors from four heats return to fight it out for a place in the final

programme.title: The Man with the Golden Gun
programme.desc: Spy adventure starring Roger Moore and Christopher Lee. James Bond goes in search of a solar-energy device stolen by professional killer Scaramanga - a hitman who carries out his million-dollar assignments with a golden gun.

programme.title: UEFA Women's Euro 2025 Final
programme.desc: England v Spain (Kick-off 5.00pm). All the action from the showpiece match, held at St Jakob-Park in Basel, Switzerland. England went into this tournament as the holders, having defeated Germany 2-1 after extra time on home soil three years ago thanks to substitute Chloe Kelly's winner, and they have had to work hard to reach this final, first finishing as runners-up to France in their group and then defeating Sweden on penalties in the quarter-finals, before prevailing 2-1 against Italy after extra time in the last four. Things are not expected to get any easier in this showpiece match, as Spain defeated England 1-0 in the 2023 FIFA World Cup final and comfortably topped their group before winning 2-0 against Switzerland in the last eight and also needing extra time in their semi-final to overcome Germany

programme.title: Karen Pirie
programme.desc: With the suspects in focus, the team works together to dive deeper into the case and Catriona's life, while Karen hits a brick wall when she comes face to face with Adam's father Fergus. When Sir Broderick then makes a shock decision, can she prove her theory before the case is shut for good?

programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Early morning chat show presented by Lorraine Kelly, with celebrity interviews, entertainment news, cooking tips, fashion features and musical guests.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Celebrity interviews and studio discussion from a female perspective

programme.title: ITV Lunchtime News
programme.desc: The key headlines from the day so far

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: Celebrity Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts as contestants Roisin Conaty, Rickie Haywood-Williams and Sunetra Sarker 'see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win £50,000 for the charity of their choice

programme.title: Lingo
programme.desc: This time, competitive brothers Louis and Connor from Stockport, married couple Julie and Joe from Hull, and quiz fans Suzy and Dave from Chester try to work out words that appear in the Lingo grids and Puzzlewords. Presented by Adil Ray

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Rosie from Chelmsford, Steve originally from Wakefield, Kallan from Cardiff and Seb from Wareham take on one of the country's finest quiz brains

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Cain and Moira take revenge on Kim, while Mack misses his opportunity to express his feelings and Robert is suspicious of John's heroism

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Abi's discovery of Kevin's despicable lie propels her into Carl's arms, Sam gives Lily a taste of her own medicine, and a meeting to determine Laila's future takes place

programme.title: Shark! Celebrity Infested Waters
programme.desc: Natural history meets adrenaline-fuelled entertainment as ocean-phobic celebrities come face-to-face with nature’s most terrifying underwater predators

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Yorkshire Ripper: The Secret Murders
programme.desc: Part two of two. The pressure continues to build on West Yorkshire Police as they step up the hunt for the killer, now being dubbed by the press, the Yorkshire Ripper. On top of the crimes that police decide to include in the Ripper investigation, murders and attempted murders with a clear link to the killer are discarded and left unsolved. When a series of mysterious letters and tapes are received by the senior detectives, the investigation is derailed even further, allowing the Ripper to go on killing. Later, a third innocent man is sent to prison for life

programme.title: Heathrow: Britain's Busiest Airport
programme.desc: Documentary going behind the scenes of the airport, finding out how its infrastructure helps staff process thousands of passengers arriving from 84 countries. The discovery of a new variant of Covid-19 causes chaos in Heathrow as airports around the world begin to close their borders to the UK. As flights are cancelled before the passengers' eyes, they scramble to get on any available plane in a desperate attempt to get home
